name: Antelope
desc: A graceful, fast-moving mammal known for its horns and agility. Antelopes inhabit grasslands and savannas across Africa and Asia.

name: Bear
desc: A large, strong mammal with thick fur. Bears are found in forests, mountains, and arctic regions, known for their strength and adaptability.

name: Cat
desc: A small, carnivorous mammal often kept as a pet. Cats are known for their agility, independence, and playful behavior.

name: Dolphin
desc: An intelligent aquatic mammal with a sleek body. Dolphins live in oceans and rivers, known for their playful nature and high intelligence.

name: Elephant
desc: The largest land mammal, recognized by its trunk and tusks. Elephants live in herds and are found in Africa and Asia.

name: Fox
desc: A small, clever mammal with a bushy tail and pointed ears. Foxes live in forests, grasslands, and even urban areas.

name: Giraffe
desc: The tallest land animal, famous for its long neck and legs. Giraffes are found in African savannas and woodlands.

name: Horse
desc: A strong, fast mammal used for riding, work, and companionship. Horses have been close to humans for thousands of years.

name: Iguana
desc: A large lizard known for its spiny back and calm nature. Iguanas live in tropical forests and are often kept as pets.

name: Jaguar
desc: A powerful big cat with a spotted coat. Jaguars are native to the Americas and are skilled hunters in forests and wetlands.

name: Kangaroo
desc: A unique marsupial with strong hind legs and a pouch. Kangaroos are native to Australia and known for their jumping ability.

name: Lion
desc: A large, social big cat known as the 'king of the jungle.' Lions live in prides and are found mostly in African savannas.

name: Monkey
desc: An intelligent, social primate found in forests and jungles. Monkeys are known for their dexterity and curiosity.

name: Newt
desc: A small amphibian with a slender body and tail. Newts live in water and on land, often found near ponds and streams.

name: Owl
desc: A nocturnal bird with large eyes and a silent flight. Owls are expert hunters, found in forests and open areas worldwide.

name: Penguin
desc: A flightless bird adapted for swimming. Penguins live in the Southern Hemisphere, mostly in Antarctica, and are known for their tuxedo-like appearance.

name: Quokka
desc: A small, friendly marsupial native to Australia. Quokkas are known for their cheerful appearance and live on islands and in forests.

name: Rabbit
desc: A small mammal with long ears and a short tail. Rabbits are popular pets and are also found in grasslands and forests.

name: Snake
desc: A legless, elongated reptile found worldwide. Snakes live in many habitats and are known for their flexible bodies and diverse species.

name: Tiger
desc: A large, striped big cat native to Asia. Tigers are powerful predators and mostly solitary animals found in forests and grasslands.

name: Urial
desc: A wild sheep with curved horns, found in Central and South Asia. Urials live in hilly and mountainous regions.

name: Vulture
desc: A large bird of prey known for scavenging. Vultures help keep ecosystems clean by feeding on dead animals.

name: Wolf
desc: A social, intelligent predator living in packs. Wolves are found in forests, tundra, and grasslands across the Northern Hemisphere.

name: Xerus
desc: A ground-dwelling squirrel found in Africa. Xerus live in colonies and are known for their burrowing and social behavior.

name: Yak
desc: A large, shaggy-haired mammal adapted to cold mountainous regions. Yaks are native to the Himalayas and are used as pack animals.

name: Zebra
desc: An African mammal known for its black-and-white striped coat. Zebras live in herds on grasslands and are closely related to horses.
